Package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.oklab

package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.oklab
Oklab, the Okay-enough LAB color space. This color space has L (lightness), A (one of the chromatic channels; somewhere between cyan-to-red and green-to-magenta), and B (the other chromatic channel; somewhere between violet-to-yellow and blue-to-orange) channels. It is a new color space that builds on the same foundation as IPT, but seems to be better-calibrated for uniform lightness and colorfulness, instead of just the emphasis on uniform hue that IPT has. Relative to IPT, Oklab has a noticeably smaller range in chromatic channels (IPT's protan and tritan can range past 0.8 or as low as 0.35, but the similar A and B channels in Oklab don't stray past about 0.65 at the upper end, if that), but it does this so the difference between two Oklab colors is just the Euclidean distance between their components. A slight difference between Oklab and IPT here is that IPT shrinks the chromatic channels to store their -1 to 1 range in a color float's 0 to 1 range, then offsets the shrunken range from -0.5 to 0.5, to 0 to 1; Oklab does not need to shrink the range, and only offsets it in the same way (both just add 0.5).
Here's Bj√∂rn Ottosson's original post introducing Oklab. So far, it stood up to analysis by Raph Levien, and seems to be gaining fans quickly. Oklab does especially well on smooth gradients.
This package offers a SimplePalette class like the one in the ipt_hq package, and compatible with the same descriptions (though the resulting colors will be a little different). Both IPT_HQ and Oklab are very good at mixing colors evenly, with Oklab probably a little better at it.

  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    com.github.tommyettinger.colorful
    Various utility classes for handling any of the color spaces, which are in subpackages of this one.
  • Classes
    Class
    Description
    ColorfulBatch
    A substitute for SpriteBatch that adds an additional attribute to store an extra color's worth of channels, used to modify the L, A, and B channels of a color by multiplication (called the "tweak") while the primary color affects the color additively (just called the color, often drawn from Palette or generated with ColorTools).
    ColorfulSprite
    Holds the geometry, color, and texture information for drawing 2D sprites using ColorfulBatch.
    ColorTools
    Contains code for manipulating colors as int and packed float values in the Oklab color space.
    GradientTools
    Static methods for handling gradients of smoothly-changing colors, typically inside of FloatArrays.
    Palette
    A palette of predefined colors as packed Oklab floats, the kind ColorTools works with.
    SimplePalette
    A palette of predefined colors as packed Oklab floats, the kind ColorTools works with, plus a way to describe colors by combinations and adjustments.
